title: Support dependency compiler overrides in packages.yaml
body:
Compilers specified in `packages.yaml` should be used for dependencies even if the dependent package is being built with a different compiler.

### Rationale

In a spack environment I use a combination of specs in `spack.yaml` and configuration in a `packages.yaml` to control what will be installed. Sometimes we try to install a package with a compiler, but one of its dependencies can't be built successfully with that compiler.

The selection of the compiler during concretization is a preference issue. Since we have indicated a preference in `packages.yaml`, that compiler should be preferred unless an explicit conflict for the specific package exists in the spec.

### Description

I want to be able to just specify the preferred compiler in `packages.yaml` and have that compiler be used for concretization unless I explicitly specify otherwise in the spec.

We can add `^dependency%other-compiler@version` to the spec in `spack.yaml`, but that gets verbose quickly.

### General information

- [X] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate

```
$ spack --version
0.14.2-1129-955a3db
```
